doc:
Walter Abel https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walter_Abel 0 Walter Abel (June 6, 1898 – March 26, 1987) was an American stage and film character actor. Known as a prolific and very dependable character actor, Abel appeared in over 200 films, beginning in the silent film era. Often portraying characters of "responsibility," (the district attorney prosecuting the lynch mob in Fury, the minister keeping morale up in a war zone in So Proudly We Hail! and the colonel leading a rescue effort in Island in the Sky), Abel was a regular in films of the 1940s and 1950s, in particular. A distinctive bearing and direct gaze were two of his trademarks. His eyes were brown and his height was 5'10" (178 cm). Walter_Abel ( June_6_,_1898 – March_26_,_1987 ) was an_American_stage_and_film_character_actor . Known as a_prolific_and_very_dependable_character_actor , Abel appeared in over_200_films , beginning in the_silent_film_era . Often portraying characters of "_responsibility , " ( the_district_attorney prosecuting the_lynch_mob in Fury , the_minister keeping morale up in a_war_zone in So Proudly We Hail ! and the_colonel leading a_rescue_effort in Island in the_Sky_) , Abel was a_regular in films of the_1940s_and_1950s , in particular . A_distinctive_bearing and direct_gaze were two of his_trademarks . His_eyes were brown and his_height was 5_'_10_"_(_178_cm_) .
